intro: Calvaria grandiflora, commonly known as the giant calvaria, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces showy, cream-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its unique fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
